components.docs:
This component built using stencyl allows an easy integration to display a gataca QR to be read by the wallet.

This component can be used with the prerequisite of having an application which can be integrated with GATACA Components: Connect  and Certify. More precisely, your application will need to be able to perform the two operations against your connect or certify servers:
1. Create sessions
2. Consult sessions

props.name: autorefresh
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Set to refresh the session automatically upon expiration. By default it is false

props.name: autostart
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Set to enable autoload when the QR is displayed. By default it is true

props.name: callbackServer
props.docs:
***Mandatory just for V1***
Connect/Certify Server where the wallet will send the data

props.name: checkStatus
props.type: (id?: string) => Promise<{ result: RESULT_STATUS; data?: any; }>
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Check status function to query the current status of the session
The function must query a client endpoint to check the status. That endpoint must return an error if the session has expired.

values.type: (id?: string) => Promise<{ result: RESULT_STATUS; data?: any; }>

props.name: createSession
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Create session function to generate a new Session
Using V1, it can provide just a session Id
Using V2, it must provide also the authentication request. The session Id is the id of the presentation definition

props.name: dynamicLink
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Display a link containing a dynamic link to invoke the wallet if closed

props.name: errorCallback
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Callback fired upon session expired or invalid
If not set, session error would not be handled
An error containing information will be passed as parameter

props.name: hideBrandTitle
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Boolean to show or not show the gataca brand title

props.name: pollingFrequency
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Frequency in seconds to check if the session has been validated

props.name: qrModalDescription
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Modifies the Modal description
props.default: "Sign up or sign in by scanning the QR Code with the Gataca Wallet"

props.name: qrModalTitle
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Modifies the qr headline title

props.name: qrRole
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Decide if scanning the credential as a verifier to request credentials
or as an issuer too issue credentials.
Options: connect | certify

props.name: sessionTimeout
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Maximum time window to display the session

props.name: successCallback
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Callback fired upon session correctly verified
If not set, session validation wouldn't trigger any action
The session data and a possible token will be sent as parameters to the callback

props.name: v2
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Set to use v2 links. The create session must be providing both an authentication request and a session Id

methods.name: display
methods.docs: Force manually the display of a QR

methods.name: getSessionData
methods.docs: Retrieve manually the session data on a successful login

events.docs: GatacaLoginCompleted event, triggered with session data upon login success
GatacaLoginFailed event, triggered with error upon login failure

components.readme:
# Gataca-QR Display This component built using stencyl allows an easy integration to display a QR with the gataca styles Continuing with that example, you could integrate in any HTML using the following code ````html Gataca QR Display Component
````
components.docs:
This component built using stencyl allows an easy integration to display a QR with the gataca styles Continuing with that example, you could integrate in any HTML using the following code ````html Gataca QR Display Component
````

props.name: logoSize
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Size of the logo to display in percentage to the total size [0-1]. 0 means no logo will be displayed. Default is the GATACA logo. Recommended size is around 0.33

props.name: logoSrc
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Logo to display, just if the logo size is greater than 0. No logo is the GATACA logo.

props.name: qrColor
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
QR Color.

props.name: qrData
props.docs:
_[Mandatory]_
Sets the contents of the QR

props.name: rounded
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Round usage

props.name: size
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Size of the QR Displayed

props.name: autorefresh
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Set to refresh the session automatically upon expiration. By default it is false

props.name: autostart
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Set to enable autoload when the QR is displayed. By default it is true

props.name: callbackServer
props.docs:
***Mandatory just for V1***
Connect/Certify Server where the wallet will send the data

props.name: dynamicLink
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Display a link containing a dynamic link to invoke the wallet if closed

props.name: errorCallback
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Callback fired upon session expired or invalid
If not set, session error would not be handled
An error containing information will be passed as parameter

props.name: hideBrandTitle
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Boolean to show or not show the gataca brand title

props.name: qrModalDescription
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Modifies the Modal description
props.default: "Sign up or sign in by scanning the QR Code with the Gataca Wallet"

props.name: qrModalTitle
props.docs:
_[Optional]_
Modifies the qr headline title

props.name: qrRole
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Decide if scanning the credential as a verifier to request credentials
or as an issuer too issue credentials.
Options: connect | certify

props.name: sessionTimeout
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Maximum time window to display the session and keep the websocket connection. It's needed to ensure the socket is closed.

props.name: socketEndpoint
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
WS Endpoint on your service to be invoked upon display

props.name: successCallback
props.docs:
***Mandatory***
Callback fired upon session correctly verified
If not set, session validation wouldn't trigger any action
The session data and a possible token will be sent as parameters to the callback

props.name: v2
props.docs:
**RECOMMENDED**
Set to use v2 links. The create session must be providing both an authentication request and a session Id

props.name: wsOnMessage
props.docs:
**RECOMMENDED**
Callback to invoke an a message has been received on the socket. It provides the socket itself and the message as parameters.
If not used, the messages provided by the server on the Socket connection must conform to the WSReponse interface
If used, an Event named **sessionMsg** must be triggered with a WSReponse as data

props.name: wsOnOpen
props.docs:
[Optional]
Function to send a message to the server upon socket creation

methods.name: display
methods.docs: Force manually the display of a QR

methods.name: getSessionData
methods.docs: Retrieve manually the session data on a successful login
